greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least number formed by concatenating the prime factors of n in base 10.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Sort {A027746(n,k): k=1..A001222(n)} lexicographically and concatenate. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 13 2013
mathematica: con[n_, k_] := Nest[Join[{#}, {n}] &, n, k - 1]; Table[Min[FromDigits /@ Flatten /@ IntegerDigits[Permutations[Flatten[con @@@ FactorInteger[n]]]]], {n, 56}] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jul 04 2013 *)
program: a073646 = read . concat . sort . map show . a027746_row
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 29 2002
